transcripts.prompt: Please transcribe the text from the following image with high accuracy. Ensure that all punctuation, capitalization, and formatting are preserved as closely as possible to the original. If any part of the text is illegible or unclear, indicate this with '[illegible]' in the transcription. Pay special attention to names, dates, and any specific terminology. Please provide only the transcription.
transcripts.original_text: I Jonathan Perkins of North Bridgewater in the County of Plymouth + State of Massachusetts, a soldier of the Revolution, and a pensioner of the United States, under the Act of June 7th, 1832. I am well acquainted with Oliver Howard of said North Bridgewater; that I have known him from our boyhood; that I was attached to a Company of minute men under Captain Josiah Hayden at the time of the alarm in April 1775 when the British marched to Lexington; I marched towards Poxbury with said Company, of which the said Oliver Howard was one; at Dorchester we were ordered to Marchfield, when we were dismissed, + returned to Bridgewater, having been absent three days; Oliver Howard afore said was with me during said three days. In 1776 or 1777 the British landed at [illegible] a sea shore in Captain David Pachand's Company - was gone two days, when we were dismissed + returned home - Oliver Howard aforesaid, was with us during the two days. In 1776, I enlisted into Captain Nathan Alolem's Company of Massachusetts militia in a Regiment commanded by Colonels Hall and Johnson, for three months, and marched to Bristol in Rhode Island, and served the full term of three months. The aforesaid Oliver Howard was with me in the same Company during the three months, at the end of which time we were dismissed without a written discharge. Jonathan Perkins Commonwealth of Massachusetts Plymouth County ls April 3rd 1834. Then personally appeared Jonathan Perkins, and subscribed the foregoing [illegible] and made oath to the truth of the same - and I further certify that said Jonathan Perkins is a man of truth and veracity. Before me, Jesse Perkins, Justice of Peace
transcripts.extracted_text: Jonathan Perkins of North Bridgewater in the County of Plymouth & State of Massachusetts, a soldier of the Revolution, and a pensioner of the United States, under the Act of June 7 - 1832 : being of the age of seventy five years, do testify and say, that I am well acquainted with Oliver Howard of said North Bridgewater, that I have known him from our boyhood : that he was attached to a Company of Minute men under Captain Josiah Hayden at the time of the alarm in April 1775 when the British marched to Lexington : marched towards Roxbury with said Company, of which the said Oliver Howard was one : at Dorchester we were ordered to Marshfield, where be were dismissed, & returned to Bridgewater, having been absent three days, Oliver Howard aforesaid was with me during said three days.  In 1776 or 1777 the British landed at Braintree or Weymouth, when an alarm was given : I then marched to the sea shore in Captin David Packard's Company - was gone two days, when we were dismissed & returned home - Oliver Howard aforesaid, was with us during the two days.  In 1776, I enlisted into Captn. Nathan Alden's Company of Massachusetts Militia in a Regiment commanded by Colonels Halls & Johnson, for three months, & marched to Bristol in Rhode Island, & served the full time of three months.  The aforesaid Oliver Howard was with me in the same Company during the three months, at the end of which time we were dismissed without a written discharge.  Jon a Perkins  Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Plymouth County ss April 3. 1834. Then personally appeared Jonathan Perkins, & subscribed the foregoing affidavit, and made oath to the truth of the same - and I further certify that said Jonathan Perkins is a man of truth & veracity. Before me Jospe Perkins, Justice of Peace
